issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Main symptoms are:

- Postgres is slow
- euca-describe-instances verbose takes up to 15 minutes (as do other API calls). Same call on same sized fully working cloud is ~ 0.5s.
- 300-4000 concurrent locks on the database. Normal cloud is ~ 40.

users are locked out from the cloud, it's basically not being used and is sat in an idle state. Number of locks on the DB during in this situation:

{noformat}
[root@acme ~]# /usr/local/bin/check_postgres.pl â€”action=locks -H /var/lib/eucalyptus/db/data/ -p 8777 -db eucalyptus_cloud -u root
POSTGRES_LOCKS CRITICAL: DB "eucalyptus_cloud" (host:/var/lib/eucalyptus/db/data/) (port=8777) total locks: 157 | time=0.01s 
database_events.total=0;100;150 eucalyptus_auth.total=0;100;150 eucalyptus_cloud.total=157;100;150 eucalyptus_config.total=0;100;150 
eucalyptus_dns.total=0;100;150 eucalyptus_faults.total=0;100;150 eucalyptus_general.total=0;100;150 eucalyptus_records.total=0;100;150 
eucalyptus_reporting.total=0;100;150 eucalyptus_storage.total=0;100;150 eucalyptus_walrus.total=0;100;150 postgres.total=0;100;150 
template1.total=0;100;150
{noformat}

It looks like {{eucalyptus_cloud}} DB is getting hammered somewhere.

With some extra logging enabled in postgres we see these errors that the cloud is spinning on (i.e. they seem to be continual):
{noformat}
ERROR:  update or delete on table "metadata_extant_network" violates foreign key constraint "fkbdc151865dab4005" on table "metadata_network_indices"
DETAIL:  Key (id)=(8a1f98a840b2dcf20140bc6d42350c2f) is still referenced from table "metadata_network_indices".
STATEMENT:  delete from metadata_extant_network where id=$1 and version=$2
ERROR:  update or delete on table "metadata_extant_network" violates foreign key constraint "fkbdc151865dab4005" on table "metadata_network_indices"
DETAIL:  Key (id)=(8a1f98a840b2dcf20140ba5ee7ff0955) is still referenced from table "metadata_network_indices".
STATEMENT:  delete from metadata_extant_network where id=$1 and version=$2
ERROR:  update or delete on table "metadata_extant_network" violates foreign key constraint "fkbdc151865dab4005" on table "metadata_network_indices"
DETAIL:  Key (id)=(8a1f98a840b2dcf20140bae83b0f0a1d) is still referenced from table "metadata_network_indices".
STATEMENT:  delete from metadata_extant_network where id=$1 and version=$2
ERROR:  update or delete on table "metadata_extant_network" violates foreign key constraint "fkbdc151865dab4005" on table "metadata_network_indices"
DETAIL:  Key (id)=(8a1f98a840b2dcf20140bbfae1e60bab) is still referenced from table "metadata_network_indices".
STATEMENT:  delete from metadata_extant_network where id=$1 and version=$2
ERROR:  update or delete on table "metadata_extant_network" violates foreign key constraint "fkbdc151865dab4005" on table "metadata_network_indices"
DETAIL:  Key (id)=(8a1f98a840b2dcf20140bbc3f7920b6e) is still referenced from table "metadata_network_indices".
STATEMENT:  delete from metadata_extant_network where id=$1 and version=$2
ERROR:  update or delete on table "metadata_extant_network" violates foreign key constraint "fkbdc151865dab4005" on table "metadata_network_indices"
DETAIL:  Key (id)=(8a1f98a840b2dcf20140bb3aa6c00ad2) is still referenced from table "metadata_network_indices".
STATEMENT:  delete from metadata_extant_network where id=$1 and version=$2
ERROR:  update or delete on table "metadata_extant_network" violates foreign key constraint "fkbdc151865dab4005" on table "metadata_network_indices"
DETAIL:  Key (id)=(8a1f98a840b2dcf20140b97082420833) is still referenced from table "metadata_network_indices".
STATEMENT:  delete from metadata_extant_network where id=$1 and version=$2

fields.summary: High Concurrent Locks on DB Causing Cloud Performance Issues

comments.body: EUCA-6243 explains the [issue|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-6243?focusedCommentId=45937&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-45937].  Recommendation is to upgrade to 3.3.0.
Issues marked fixed in currently released versions of the software. Moving to Closed fixed
